column4: Still having the same problem, can play videos off of youtube and google video, but not any wmv files nor no quicktime files. I've installed w32codecs, mplayer, etc
try http://fredrik.hubbe.net/plugger/test.html ; there's a bunch of test links there, possibly you can narrow down what's working, what's not
in firefox location box, type about:plugins
yeah it only shows shockwave and futuresplash
i know it should show the others i've installed, but it doesn't
that is most strange; are you using firefox 1.5?
look at !ff1.5 ; the page referenced there tells you how to get the plugins working
i've run that before, but i'll do it again
it's the linking that counts:  sudo ln -s /usr/lib/mozilla-firefox/plugins/* from your firefox plugin directory
next, I'd change my mplayer config, see $wiki/MplayerInstallHowto
Edited the config file as the website specified, same problem still
I'm not sure what your problem is, then. I had other issues with 1.5, so I switched back to 1.0.7 in breezy. I don't have an install to play with
I'm on dapper, and everything works well. I'll see you in #ubuntu+1, by some miracle, maybe I can help
hey i appreciate all the help thus far man
